intro: Phyllanthus leptocaulos, commonly known as the slender-stemmed phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant typically has small, clustered leaves and produces yellowish or greenish flowers. Its stems are slender and often branched, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Phyllanthus leptocaulos is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
